Journey on The Ghan

The Journey

The Ghan is a journey of 3000 kilometres, amongst some of the harshest terrain on the planet, from the north to the south of Australia.

This was the vast desert inland that tested colonial explorers for decades.

Today the landscapes haven’t changed but the expeditions have. We’ll be travelling on board a luxury train.

See more

The Stops

The Ghan Expedition stops during the days as it travels down the country through the desert.

Along the way, you’ll discover the unique culture that's lasted for tens of thousands of years, the town where the residents live underground and the spiritual centre of the country.

This is more than a train trip. It’s a journey into the heart of Australia.

Explore here

The Podcast

Along the way, you’ll meet indigenous owners of the land, local residents of the outback, and your fellow passengers. Of course, you’ll also get to know the staff who are on the train for the journey.

In this podcast series, you can listen to some them tell their stories.

Listen to the seven short episodes now!

Listen now
